page.title: 14Employment & Industry
page.content: The seasonal influx of holidaymakers provides employment for people in the hotel and catering industries,but less so than in neighbouring Hastings.The Hastings language schools import thousands of foreign students from Continental Europe in Summer.They bring revenue to the town and its transport system which benefits St.Leonard's also,for host families there provide accommodation for the students,too.There is some arable and livestock farming,light industry including a timber yard,a dairy,a road haulage depot,a toolmakers,electrical and metal goods manufacturers and distributors,an auction room and antique shops.At Bulverhythe are a British Rail servicing and a Council depots.Nearby the former trolleybus depot stores liquid propane gas.Shops and old people's homes employ many.
